self.name: TCA Alert Definition
self.description: The format of the output event from TCA

closedLoopControlName.description: This is the unique ID for the Control Loop. It is created by the CLAMP platform during Control Loop design

requestID.description: For the control loop, when an instance of the Control Loop occurs, this unique ID must be created. The same ID must be forwarded for both the ONSET and the ABATED control loop messages

closedLoopEventStatus.description: This is the status of the closedLoopControlName/requestID pair

closedLoopAlarmStart.description: When the alarm was first detected

closedLoopAlarmEnd.description: When the alarm was cleared. This field need only be present in the ABATED message

closedLoopEventClient.description: For monitoring/logging/auditing purposes, if there is an instance ID of the DCAE micro service this field should be populated with it

policyVersion.description: The version of the Policy driving the DCAE Micro service. Should be a part of the configuration policy setup by CLAMP and passed by DCAE controller

policyName.description: The name of the Policy driving the DCAE micro service. Should be a part of the configuration policy setup by CLAMP and passed by DCAE controller

policyScope.description: The scope of the Policy driving the DCAE micro service. Should be a part of the configuration policy setup by CLAMP and passed by DCAE controller

from.description: The ONAP platform component publishing this message

target_type.description: The type of the target: VM or VNF

target.description: This is the name of the field within the A&AI sub-tag that indicates the actual entity Node details. There should be a matching node field within the A&AI subtag holding this value
